page.title: 08LAW & ORDER KIRKHAM PRISON
page.content:
H.M. PRISON KIRKHAM
The Prison just outside Kirkham was used in the 1940's as a Royal Air Force station. No planes landed there so they closed it down and used it as an open prison. Lower Lane was used as the Officer's Quarters for the R.A.F. Station. Just outside the Prison were Quarters built for the Officers called The Mede. The hangars are now used for a gym and store shed where they keep wooden items which the prisoners make. The prisoners grow vegetables, and salad foods which are sold to the Officers and also taken to feed prisoners in other prisons in addition feeding the inmates at Kirkham. Flowers are also grown giving the prison a look more of a nursery or garden centre rather than a penal institution.
